item.title: When Corporations Kill - Progressive Roundtable
item.description:
When Corporations Kill - Progressive Roundtable

Alex Lawson, Social Security Works & Sarah Badawi, Progressive Change Campaign Committee (PCCC) join Thom. Plus Special Panel Guest - Patty Lovera, Food & Water Watch. The Department of Justice is launching an investigation into the Dole Food company - one of the world's largest processors of fresh produce.

item.title: Guarding Against Chernobyl's Radioactive Forest Fires
item.description:
Guarding Against Chernobyl's Radioactive Forest Fires

Thirty years after the Chernobyl disaster, firefighters remain on high alert to prevent radioactive forest fires. Originally published at - http://www.rferl.org/media/video/guarding-against-chernobyls-radioactive-forest-fires/27691519.html

item.description:
A Turning Point for China?

In this film, William Nee discusses what it's like doing human rights work in China today, and tells the story of Pu Zhiqiang, one of China's most famous fre...

item.title: Masked Anti-Putin Protester Detained Again In Red Square
item.description:
Masked Anti-Putin Protester Detained Again In Red Square

Performance artist Roman Roslovtsev returned to Red Square to stage his latest masked protest against Russian President Vladimir Putin and a law on public ga...

item.title: Nigeria Military Intensifies Efforts to Rescue Civilians Abducted By Boko Haram
item.description:
Nigeria Military Intensifies Efforts to Rescue Civilians Abducted By Boko Haram

The Nigerian military has launched a military offensive aimed at putting pressure on the Islamist militant group Boko Haram as well as rescue unarmed civilians kidnapped by the militants, according to military spokesman Colonel Sani Kukasheka Usman.

item.title: Kenyans Challenge Society Via New Art Form
item.description:
Kenyans Challenge Society Via New Art Form

By day, Sam Muremi is the quintessential entrepreneur. He and his sister run a bakery out of their home. But pastries are not his only passion. He writes poems during his breaks. By night, he takes to the stage under his alter ego, "Ecks." "You are here.

item.title: Egyptian Court Sentences 6 to Death, Delays Morsi Verdict
item.description:
Egyptian Court Sentences 6 to Death, Delays Morsi Verdict

An Egyptian court has handed down death sentences to six defendants in a trial for Egypt's ousted president Mohamed Morsi and nearly a dozen other co-defendants for the alleged transfer of secret information to the Gulf state of Qatar. Morsi's verdict was postponed.

item.title: Afghanistan, Pakistan Trade Accusations
item.description:
Afghanistan, Pakistan Trade Accusations

Pakistan has "greater control" over the Taliban than the Afghan government "initially thought," but contrary to its public assurances, Islamabad has never intended to bring the insurgency to peace talks with Kabul, allege senior Afghan officials. "In fact Pakistan's old policy vis-a-vis Afghanistan that was claimed to be abandoned in fact has not been," a close aide to Afghan President Ashraf Ghani told VOA.
